summary: This is an email chain from August 30, 2018, discussing the purchase of cameras for the New York Federal Bureau of Prisons. The conversation centers on whether specific camera models require further authorization under FITARA (Federal Information Technology Acquisition Reform Act) and the process for streamlining the acquisition.

persons.name: MCC
persons.context: Appears to be the sender of the email, responding to a prior conversation about camera purchases and confirming that approved hardware does not need further authorization.

events.title: FITARA Camera Authorization Discussion
events.description: Email exchange regarding the need for authorization under FITARA to purchase cameras not on the approved hardware list for the New York Federal Bureau of Prisons.

locations: New York Federal Bureau of Prisons
keyFacts: The email discusses procurement procedures for cameras at the New York Federal Bureau of Prisons under FITARA regulations.
It mentions that cameras not on the approved hardware list require specific authorization.
The correspondence indicates planned coordination with a Regional Comm Tech and Signet to streamline the acquisition process.
